name: Kwame Nkrumah Memorial Park
description: A serene park and mausoleum dedicated to Ghana's first president and independence leader.

name: Labadi Beach
description: Accra's most famous beach with live music, horse riding, and vibrant weekend vibes.

name: Makola Market
description: The commercial heartbeat of Accra – bustling with fabrics, spices, and local trade.

name: Independence Arch
description: Iconic monument commemorating Ghana's independence from British rule in 1957.

name: Jamestown Lighthouse
description: Historic lighthouse in one of Accra's oldest neighborhoods, rich in culture and fishing heritage.

name: Osu Castle (Christiansborg)
description: Former seat of government and a significant site in the history of the transatlantic slave trade.

name: Aburi Botanical Gardens
address: Aburi, Eastern Region (45 mins from Accra)
description: Lush, peaceful gardens with towering trees and cool breezes – a perfect day escape.

name: National Museum of Ghana
description: Home to Ghana’s finest collection of historical, cultural, and artistic treasures.
